column4: what use is the 'startup applications' thing? I click on 'add', and there's no apps visible.
if I then click 'browse', there's all my documents, but still no apps.
you can hit "/" to type a path to an app
/usr/bin enter
but you prolly just wanna type /usr/bin/appname there
still, it doesn't list the stuff that runs as part of gnome-session anymore  :(
It assumes you know what you're doing... I just told you what to do
then in the command space enter /usr/bin/tomboy
It should be more obvious, but it isn't
because you are using 11.10
That is the full version from gnome2... now you have as far as the port to gnome3 has gotten
you can assist with the docs getting up to date if you'd like to reflect current status, no one else has yet
Simply sign up for a lp account, and log into the wiki with it... it will let you edit pages but not on help.ubuntu.com (that is more for completed works)
Uses same system as for example wikipedia, very easy to understand
I am mostly pointing out that it is a community process, that means work that no one does doesn't get done
Certainly, but if you cannot, then you will have to wait for someone else to do it instead
Firstly, I have told you how to accomplish what you want, second, you are the one that pointed out the complatency with the docs
I have said simply add /usr/bin/tomboy to the command textbox
get out of browse... the textbox next to browse... enter /usr/bin/tomboy
whatsoever you like for name and description, irrelevant
the tool was slapped together so the functionality is at least there... I have told you how to use that functionality
